description: Check pseudo-label quality with K=8 samples per prompt using base model
question: Does increasing K from 4 to 8 improve pseudo-label accuracy above 50%?
interpretation: K=8 improved accuracy from 38% to 52%, crossing our 50% threshold. High-confidence examples remain 100% accurate but are rarer (8 vs 13). The improvement confirms the model CAN be right more often with more samples, but it's borderline.
decision: PROCEED with V1 experiment using K=8
next_step: Run full V1: baseline vs noisy student vs oracle
